result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott C George was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
IF REVOKED: Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and or/school.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with victim or victim's residence.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Court will allow transfer to Washington County.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Huppertz
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott C George in court with attorney Matthew H Huppertz.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - none)
  -  15 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  15 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  victim or victim's residence
*Perform 40 hours Community Service

RESTITUTION:  previously paid

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

CONDITION TIME: 30 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given. 

Court will allow transfer to Washington County.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 23, 2017 at 10:00 am.
